value.title: Working Hours Policy
value.content:
Contoso Corporation Working Hours Policy

Standard Business Hours:
Contoso Corporation's standard business hours are Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM local time. All employees are expected to be available during these core hours unless alternative arrangements have been approved by their manager.

Flexible Work Arrangements:
Contoso recognizes the importance of work-life balance and offers flexible work arrangements where operationally feasible. Employees may request flexible start and end times, subject to manager approval and business needs. Common arrangements include:
- Early start (7:00 AM - 3:00 PM)
- Late start (10:00 AM - 6:00 PM)
- Compressed workweek (subject to role requirements)

Remote Work:
Eligible employees may work remotely up to 3 days per week with manager approval. Remote work arrangements must be formalized through the HR department and reviewed quarterly.

Overtime:
Non-exempt employees who work more than 40 hours in a workweek will receive overtime compensation at 1.5 times their regular hourly rate. All overtime must be pre-approved by the employee's direct manager. Exempt employees are not eligible for overtime compensation but may be eligible for compensatory time off at manager discretion.

Break Periods:
Employees working 6 or more hours are entitled to a 30-minute unpaid lunch break and two 15-minute paid rest breaks. Employees are encouraged to take regular breaks to maintain productivity and well-being.

Time Tracking:
All employees must accurately record their work hours using the company's time tracking system. Time records are due by end of day each Friday and must be approved by managers within 2 business days.

Questions:
For questions about working hours or to request flexible arrangements, please contact your direct manager or the HR department at hr@contoso.com.

value.title: Vacation and Time Off Policy
value.content:
Contoso Corporation Vacation and Time Off Policy

Paid Time Off (PTO) Accrual:
Contoso provides generous paid time off to all regular full-time employees. PTO accrues based on length of service:
- Years 0-2: 15 days per year (1.25 days per month)
- Years 3-5: 20 days per year (1.67 days per month)
- Years 6+: 25 days per year (2.08 days per month)

PTO begins accruing from the first day of employment and is available for use after 90 days of employment.

PTO Usage:
PTO can be used for vacation, personal time, or any other purpose. Employees are encouraged to use their PTO to maintain work-life balance and prevent burnout. PTO requests should be submitted through the company HR portal at least 2 weeks in advance for requests of 3 or more consecutive days. Manager approval is required for all PTO requests.

PTO Carryover:
Up to 5 unused PTO days may be carried over to the next calendar year. Any PTO in excess of 5 days will be forfeited on December 31st. Employees are encouraged to use their PTO throughout the year.

Holidays:
In addition to PTO, Contoso observes the following paid holidays:
- New Year's Day
- Martin Luther King Jr. Day
- Memorial Day
- Independence Day
- Labor Day
- Thanksgiving Day and the Friday following
- Christmas Eve and Christmas Day
- New Year's Eve

Floating Holidays:
Employees receive 2 floating holidays per year that can be used at their discretion with manager approval.

PTO Payout:
Upon termination of employment, employees will be paid for any unused accrued PTO up to the maximum carryover amount (5 days), provided they give at least 2 weeks notice.

Part-Time Employees:
Part-time employees working at least 20 hours per week are eligible for prorated PTO based on their scheduled hours.

Questions:
For questions about PTO or to request time off, please contact your manager or HR at hr@contoso.com.

value.title: Paid Sick Leave Policy
value.content:
Contoso Corporation Paid Sick Leave Policy

Purpose:
Contoso Corporation is committed to the health and well-being of our employees and their families. This paid sick leave policy provides employees with paid time off to recover from illness or injury, care for sick family members, or attend medical appointments.

Sick Leave Accrual:
All regular employees (full-time and part-time) accrue sick leave at the rate of 1 day per month, up to a maximum accrual of 60 days. Sick leave begins accruing on the first day of employment and is available for use immediately.

Permitted Uses:
Sick leave may be used for:
- Employee's own illness, injury, or medical condition
- Medical, dental, or vision appointments for the employee
- Care for an immediate family member (spouse, child, parent, sibling) who is ill or has a medical appointment
- Care for a family member or household member as required by law
- Circumstances arising from domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking involving the employee or family member

Notification Requirements:
Employees should notify their manager as soon as possible when they need to use sick leave, preferably before the start of their scheduled shift. For absences of 3 or more consecutive days, employees may be required to provide medical documentation.

Sick Leave vs PTO:
Sick leave is separate from PTO (vacation time). Employees should use sick leave for health-related absences and reserve PTO for vacation and personal time. However, employees may choose to use PTO for sick time if they prefer.

Carryover:
Unused sick leave carries over from year to year up to the maximum accrual of 60 days. There is no annual forfeiture of sick leave.

Payout:
Sick leave is not paid out upon termination of employment. The purpose of sick leave is to provide income protection during illness, not as additional compensation.

Abuse of Sick Leave:
Contoso expects employees to use sick leave appropriately. Patterns of abuse, such as frequent Monday or Friday absences or use of sick leave immediately after PTO requests are denied, may result in disciplinary action. Sick leave may not be used to extend vacation or for other non-health-related purposes.

Disability Leave:
For serious health conditions requiring extended absence, employees should contact HR about short-term or long-term disability leave options, which may provide additional benefits beyond sick leave.

Questions:
For questions about sick leave, please contact HR at hr@contoso.com or 1-800-CONTOSO.

value.title: Leaving Contoso Corporation - Offboarding Process
value.content:
Contoso Corporation Offboarding Process - Leaving the Company

Notice Period:
Employees who decide to leave Contoso are requested to provide at least 2 weeks written notice to their manager and HR. Senior level employees (Director and above) are requested to provide 4 weeks notice. Providing adequate notice ensures a smooth transition and maintains positive professional relationships.

Resignation Submission:
Resignations should be submitted in writing via email to your direct manager and HR at hr@contoso.com. Your resignation should include your intended last date of work.

Exit Interview:
All departing employees are invited to participate in an exit interview with HR. This is an opportunity to provide feedback about your experience at Contoso, discuss your reasons for leaving, and share suggestions for improvement. Exit interviews are confidential and help us improve our workplace.

Knowledge Transfer:
Departing employees are expected to work with their manager to ensure a proper transition of responsibilities. This may include:
- Documenting current projects and their status
- Training team members or replacement employees
- Organizing and archiving files and documents
- Updating process documentation
- Providing contact information for key clients or vendors

Company Property Return:
All company property must be returned by your last day of employment, including:
- Laptop computer and accessories
- Mobile phone and accessories
- Access badges and keys
- Company credit cards
- Any other company equipment or property

Final Paycheck:
Your final paycheck will be issued on the next regular payroll date following your last day. This will include:
- Wages for all time worked
- Payout of unused PTO (up to 5 days)
- Any other owed compensation

Continued Benefits:
Health insurance coverage continues through the end of the month of your last day of employment. You will receive information about COBRA continuation coverage, which allows you to maintain health insurance at your own cost for up to 18 months.

401(k) and Retirement:
You may choose to:
- Leave your 401(k) with Contoso's plan provider
- Roll over your 401(k) to a new employer's plan
- Roll over your 401(k) to an IRA
- Take a distribution (taxes and penalties may apply)

You will receive information from our 401(k) provider about your options within 2 weeks of your departure.

Non-Compete and Confidentiality:
Employees are reminded that any non-compete, non-solicitation, and confidentiality agreements remain in effect after employment ends. Please review these agreements and direct any questions to legal@contoso.com.

References:
Contoso's policy is to confirm dates of employment and job title only. Managers may provide personal references at their discretion.

Rehire Eligibility:
Employees who leave Contoso in good standing (with proper notice, successful knowledge transfer, and return of company property) are eligible for rehire. We value our alumni and welcome former employees to return.

Questions:
For questions about the offboarding process, please contact HR at hr@contoso.com or call 1-800-CONTOSO.

Thank you for your contributions to Contoso Corporation. We wish you the best in your future endeavors!

value.title: Employee Benefits Overview
value.content:
Contoso Corporation Employee Benefits Overview

Health Insurance:
Contoso offers comprehensive health insurance coverage to all regular full-time employees and their eligible dependents. We offer multiple plan options including:
- PPO (Preferred Provider Organization) with nationwide coverage
- HMO (Health Maintenance Organization) for lower cost option
- High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP) with HSA

The company pays 80% of employee premiums and 50% of dependent premiums. Coverage begins on the first day of the month following 30 days of employment.

Dental and Vision Insurance:
Comprehensive dental and vision insurance plans are available. The company pays 75% of employee premiums for both dental and vision coverage. Coverage includes preventive care, basic and major services for dental, and annual eye exams and eyewear allowances for vision.

401(k) Retirement Plan:
Contoso offers a 401(k) retirement savings plan with company matching. Employees may contribute up to the IRS maximum, and Contoso matches 100% of contributions up to 6% of salary. All employees are eligible to participate immediately upon hire, with company matching beginning after 90 days of employment. Employees are fully vested in company contributions after 3 years of service.

Life Insurance:
Contoso provides basic life insurance coverage equal to 1x annual salary at no cost to employees. Supplemental life insurance is available for purchase for employee, spouse, and dependent children.

Disability Insurance:
Short-term and long-term disability insurance is provided at no cost to employees. Short-term disability provides 60% of salary for up to 90 days. Long-term disability provides 60% of salary after 90 days of disability, up to age 65.

Employee Assistance Program (EAP):
All employees and their household members have access to confidential counseling and support services through our EAP. Services include mental health counseling, financial planning assistance, legal consultation, and work-life resources.

Professional Development:
Contoso is committed to employee growth and development. Benefits include:
- Annual professional development budget of $2,000 per employee
- Access to online learning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Coursera)
- Tuition reimbursement up to $5,000 per year for job-related degree programs
- Internal training programs and workshops

Wellness Programs:
Contoso promotes employee wellness through:
- On-site fitness center or gym membership reimbursement
- Annual health screening and flu shots
- Wellness challenges and incentives
- Mental health resources and meditation apps

Commuter Benefits:
Pre-tax commuter benefits are available for public transportation and parking expenses, allowing employees to save up to 30% on commuting costs.

Employee Discounts:
Employees enjoy discounts on Contoso products and services, as well as discounts through our corporate partnerships with various retailers, travel providers, and entertainment venues.

For complete details on benefits, eligibility, and enrollment, please visit the benefits section of the employee portal or contact HR at benefits@contoso.com.

value.title: Remote Work and Hybrid Policy
value.content:
Contoso Corporation Remote Work and Hybrid Work Policy

Policy Overview:
Contoso Corporation embraces flexible work arrangements to support employee work-life balance while maintaining strong collaboration and company culture. This policy outlines the guidelines for remote and hybrid work.

Eligibility:
Remote and hybrid work arrangements are available to employees whose roles can be performed effectively outside the office. Eligibility is determined by:
- Job responsibilities and requirements
- Performance history
- Manager approval
- Department operational needs

New employees must complete 90 days in-office before becoming eligible for remote or hybrid work arrangements.

Hybrid Work Options:
Eligible employees may choose from the following hybrid arrangements:
- Option 1: In office 2 days per week (remote 3 days)
- Option 2: In office 3 days per week (remote 2 days)
- Option 3: In office 4 days per week (remote 1 day)

Core Collaboration Days:
All hybrid employees are required to be in office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays to facilitate team collaboration, meetings, and company events.

Fully Remote Work:
Fully remote positions (100% remote) are available for select roles with VP approval. Fully remote employees must:
- Live in a state where Contoso is registered to operate
- Be available during core business hours (9 AM - 5 PM their local time)
- Maintain a professional home office environment
- Travel to company offices quarterly for team meetings

Home Office Requirements:
Remote employees must maintain a workspace that is:
- Safe, secure, and free from distractions
- Equipped with reliable high-speed internet (minimum 50 Mbps)
- Private and appropriate for video calls
- Compliant with local zoning and homeowner association rules

Equipment and Technology:
Contoso provides:
- Laptop computer and necessary software
- Monitor, keyboard, and mouse upon request
- Stipend of $500 for home office setup
- Monthly internet reimbursement of $50

Communication Expectations:
Remote employees must:
- Be responsive during core business hours
- Keep Outlook/Teams calendar updated
- Maintain video-on policy for meetings
- Respond to messages within 2 hours during business hours
- Join daily team standups when applicable

Performance and Accountability:
Remote work is a privilege contingent on sustained performance. Managers will evaluate remote work arrangements quarterly based on:
- Meeting performance goals and deliverables
- Communication and collaboration effectiveness
- Attendance and availability
- Team feedback

Security and Confidentiality:
Remote employees must:
- Use VPN for all company network access
- Secure all company devices and information
- Never allow others to use company equipment
- Follow all information security policies
- Report any security incidents immediately

Work Hours and Overtime:
Remote work does not change work hour requirements or overtime policies. Non-exempt employees must accurately track all time worked and obtain approval for any overtime.

Changes to Work Location:
Employees planning to work from a location other than their designated home office (e.g., traveling, temporary relocation) must notify their manager and obtain approval in advance.

Termination of Remote Work:
The company reserves the right to modify or terminate remote work arrangements at any time based on business needs, performance issues, or policy violations.

For questions about remote work eligibility or to request a hybrid work arrangement, contact your manager or HR at remotework@contoso.com.
